alert.note: Alert for Custer; Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 8:16PM CDT until July 21 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Lincoln County in southwestern Nebraska... Southwestern Custer County in central Nebraska... * Until 900 PM CDT. * At 815 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Arnold to 6 miles west of Lake Maloney State Recreation Area, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... North Platte, Brady, Maxwell, Lake Maloney State Recreation Area, North Platte Airport, Keith, Cottonwood Canyon State Wildlife Management Area, Etna and Jeffrey Canyon State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 174 and 205. Highway 83 between mile markers 67 and 84. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
